item.text: Then he brought me to the outer sanctuary and measured the jambs; the jambs were 10½ feet wide on each side.
The width of the entrance was 17½ feet, and the sides of the entrance were 8¾ feet on each side. He measured the length of the outer sanctuary as 70 feet and its width as 35 feet.
Then he went into the inner sanctuary and measured the jambs of the entrance as 3½ feet, the entrance as 10½ feet, and the width of the entrance as 12¼ feet.
Then he measured its length as 35 feet and its width as 35 feet, before the outer sanctuary. He said to me, “This is the Most Holy Place.”
Then he measured the wall of the temple as 10½ feet and the width of the side chambers as 7 feet, all around the temple.

The <st data-num="06763" class="">side chambers</st> were in <st data-num="07969" class="">three stories</st>, <st data-num="0413 06763">one above the other</st>, <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="06471" class="">in each story</st>. There were <st data-num="0935" class="">offsets</st> in the <st data-num="07023 0834 01004">wall</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">all</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st> to <st data-num="01961" class="">serve</st> as <st data-num="0270" class="">supports</st> for the <st data-num="06763" class="">side</st> <st data-num="06763" class="">chambers</st>, so that the <st data-num="0270" class="">supports</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> in the <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.

The side chambers surrounding the temple were wider at each successive story, for the structure surrounding the temple went up story by story all around the temple. For this reason the width of the temple increased as it went up, and one went up from the lowest story to the highest by the way of the middle story.
I saw that the temple had a raised platform all around; the foundations of the side chambers were a full measuring stick of 10½ feet high.

The <st data-num="07341" class="">width</st> of the <st data-num="0413 02351">outer</st> <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="06763" class="">side chambers</st> was <st data-num="02568" class="">8¾</st> <st data-num="0520" class="">feet</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="0834 03240">open area</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the <st data-num="06763" class="">side chambers</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>

<st data-num="0996" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="03957" class="">chambers</st> of the court was <st data-num="06242" class="">35</st> <st data-num="0520" class="">feet</st><n id="1" /> in <st data-num="07341" class="">width</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">all around</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="05439 05439">on every side</st>.
There were entrances from the side chambers toward the open area, one entrance toward the north, and another entrance toward the south; the width of the open area was 8¾ feet all around.
The building that was facing the temple courtyard at the west side was 122½ feet wide; the wall of the building was 8¾ feet thick all around, and its length 157½ feet.
Then he measured the temple as 175 feet long, the courtyard of the temple and the building and its walls as 175 feet long,
and also the width of the front of the temple and the courtyard on the east as 175 feet.

Then he measured the length of the building facing the courtyard at the rear of the temple, with its galleries on either side as 175 feet.

The interior of the outer sanctuary and the porch of the court,

as well as the <st data-num="05592" class="">thresholds</st>, <st data-num="0331" class="">narrow</st> <st data-num="02474" class="">windows</st>, and <st data-num="0862" class="">galleries</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">all around</st> on <st data-num="07969" class="">three sides</st> <st data-num="05048" class="">facing</st> the <st data-num="05592" class="">threshold</st>, were <st data-num="07824" class="">paneled</st> with <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">all</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st>, from the <st data-num="0776" class="">ground</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">up to</st> the <st data-num="02474" class="">windows</st> (now the <st data-num="02474" class="">windows</st> were <st data-num="03680" class="">covered</st>),

<st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05921" class="">space above</st> the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st>, <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="06442" class="">inner</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">room</st>, and on the <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st> and <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="07023 05439 05439">walls</st> in the <st data-num="06442" class="">inner room</st> and <st data-num="02435" class="">outside</st>, by <st data-num="04060" class="">measurement</st>.<n id="1" />

It was <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> with <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> and <st data-num="08561" class="">decorative palm trees</st>, with a <st data-num="08561" class="">palm tree</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">each</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub</st>. Each <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub</st> had <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">faces</st>:

a <st data-num="0120" class="">human</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">face</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">toward</st> the <st data-num="08561" class="">palm tree</st> <st data-num="06311" class="">on one side</st> and a <st data-num="03715" class="">lion’s</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">face</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">toward</st> the <st data-num="08561" class="">palm tree</st> <st data-num="06311" class="">on the other side</st>. They were <st data-num="06213" class="">carved</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">all</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st>;

from the <st data-num="0776" class="">ground</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05921" class="">area above</st> the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st>, <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> and <st data-num="08561" class="">decorative palm trees</st> were <st data-num="06213" class="">carved</st> on the <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st> of the <st data-num="01964" class="">outer sanctuary</st>.

The <st data-num="04201" class="">doorposts</st> of the <st data-num="01964" class="">outer sanctuary</st> <st data-num="07251" class="">were square</st>. <st data-num="06440" class="">In front of</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">sanctuary</st> one doorpost <st data-num="04758" class="">looked</st> <st data-num="04758" class="">just like</st> the other.
The altar was of wood, 5¼ feet high, with its length 3½ feet; its corners, its length, and its walls were of wood. He said to me, “This is the table that is before the Lord.”

The <st data-num="01964" class="">outer sanctuary</st> and the <st data-num="06944" class="">inner sanctuary</st> each had a <st data-num="08147" class="">double</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">door</st>.

Each of the <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> had <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">leaves</st>, <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="04142" class="">swinging</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01817" class="">leaves</st>; <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> leaves for <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">door</st> and <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">leaves</st> for the <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st>.

<st data-num="0413 0413">On</st> the <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> of the <st data-num="01964" class="">outer sanctuary</st> were <st data-num="06213" class="">carved</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> and <st data-num="08561" class="">palm trees</st>, like <st data-num="0834" class="">those</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">carved</st> on the <st data-num="07023" class="">walls</st>, and there was a <st data-num="05646" class="">canopy</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="06440" class="">front</st> of the <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st> <st data-num="0197" class="">porch</st>.
There were narrow windows and decorative palm trees on either side of the side walls of the porch; this is what the side chambers of the temple and the canopies were like.
